meanings.definition: A round plane figure whose boundary consists of points equidistant from a fixed point.
meanings.sent1: The children sat in a circle during story time.
meanings.sent2: The ringmaster drew a perfect circle on the ground.
meanings.sent3: The circle of friends enjoyed a picnic in the park.
meanings.sent4: The moon cast a soft circle of light on the lake.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully painted a colorful circle on the canvas.

meanings.definition: A group of people or things forming a circle.
meanings.sent1: The students formed a circle to play a game.
meanings.sent2: The protestors stood in a tight circle outside the building.
meanings.sent3: The circle of trees provided shade on a hot day.
meanings.sent4: The circle of chairs surrounded the campfire.
meanings.sent5: The circle of dancers moved gracefully to the music.

meanings.definition: To move all the way around something in a circular shape.
meanings.sent1: The dog likes to circle around before lying down.
meanings.sent2: The plane will circle the airport before landing.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to circle the elusive mouse.
meanings.sent4: The hawk circled high above in search of prey.
meanings.sent5: The athlete will circle the track in the final lap.
